articles.author: Samia Nakhoul, Jonathan Saul
articles.description: A careful campaign of deception ensured Israel was caught off guard when the Palestinian Islamist group Hamas launched its devastating attack, enabling a force using bulldozers, hang gliders and motorbikes to take on the Middle East's most powerful army.
articles.title: How Israel was duped as Hamas planned devastating assault

articles.author: Emily Rose
articles.description: When Avidor Schwartzman was woken by booming noises on Saturday morning, his first instinct was to grab his one-year-old daughter and his second was to think the disturbance wouldn't last long.
articles.title: 'Between a warzone and pure hell': Israeli describes kibbutz attack

articles.author: Steve Holland, Matt Spetalnick
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden and Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, uncomfortable allies in the best of times, will put their uneasy relationship to a further test with Israel preparing a possible ground assault on the Palestinian Gaza Strip.
articles.title: Analysis: Israel-Hamas war forces Biden and Netanyahu into uneasy partnership

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: As Israel's military sent phone messages telling Palestinians to leave some areas of Gaza after Saturday's deadly Hamas raid, Mohammad Brais did not know where to seek safety from an assault that residents expect to be the worst they have ever faced.
articles.title: Gazans say nowhere to go as they prepare for Israeli assault after Hamas raid

articles.author: Andrew Gray, Sarah Marsh
articles.description: The European Commission said on Monday it was putting all of its development aid for Palestinians, worth 691 million euros ($729 million), under review and immediately suspending all payments following Hamas' attack on Israel.
articles.title: EU freezes development aid to Palestinians after Hamas attack

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The United States on Monday said nine Americans were killed in Israel and other U.S. citizens were missing, following Saturday's unprecedented Hamas attack that killed 700 Israelis.
articles.title: U.S. says nine Americans killed in Israel, others still missing

articles.author: Henriette Chacar, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel's troops were battling on Monday to clear out Hamas gunmen more than two days after they burst across the fence from Gaza on a deadly rampage, and the army said it would soon go on the offensive after the biggest mobilisation in Israeli history.
articles.title: Clashes rage in Israel as Hamas fighters hold out 'longer than expected'

articles.author: Douglas Gillison, Joanna Plucinska, Sophie Yu
articles.description: Major international air carriers have suspended or reined in flight services to or from Tel Aviv after a surprise attack by Hamas militants on Israel over the weekend, saying they were waiting for safety conditions to improve.
articles.title: Several airlines suspend flights after attack on Israel

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: American economic historian Claudia Goldin won the 2023 Nobel economics prize for "having advanced our understanding of women's labour market outcomes", the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences said on Monday.
articles.title: Nobel economics prize goes to Claudia Goldin

articles.author: Gloria Dickie
articles.description: Billions of people could struggle to survive in periods of deadly, humid heat within this century as temperatures rise, particularly in some of the world's largest cities, from Delhi to Shanghai, according to research published on Monday.
articles.title: Deadly humid heat could hit billions, spread as far as US Midwest, study says
